meanings.definition: To enroll as a student in a college or university.
meanings.sent1: I will matriculate at the university next fall.
meanings.sent2: She decided to matriculate at the local college to pursue her degree.
meanings.sent3: The eager student couldn't wait to matriculate and start learning.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to matriculate was like opening a door to a world of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: Matriculating into college felt like stepping into a new chapter of life.

meanings.definition: To be admitted or accepted into a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: After passing the interview, he was able to matriculate into the exclusive club.
meanings.sent2: She was thrilled to matriculate into the team after a successful tryout.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to matriculate into the group of seals, thinking it was a club.
meanings.sent4: His unique skills allowed him to matriculate into the top-tier organization effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: Matriculating into the society of artists was a dream come true for her.
